page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY - FORRES EAST
page.content: Nelson's Tower is built on Cluny Hill, Forres.It is an octagonal shaped tower built in 1806 to commemorate the death of Admiral Lord Nelson in the Battle of Trafalgar, (1805). Inside there was originally a marble bust of Lord Nelson, and two cannons from Lord Nelson's victorious Trafalgar ship, the Victory. It has many uses, as a navigational beacon for ships and aircraft, as a vantage point or lookout post in time of war and as a viewpoint. Inside there is also a stone spiral staircase leading to the top 70 feet above the ground.From the top, the surrounding countryside is spread out beneath, giving a considerable view of up to 30km on a clear day. Recently the tower was closed because the masonry and woodwork is all crumbling and could collapse.
